title: Executive Order 6880-Amendment of Executive Order No. 6657-A, Dated March 27, 1934
content: Section 1 (e) of Executive Order No. 6657-A, of March 27, 1934, prescribing regulations for payment of losses sustained by officers, enlisted men, and employees of the United States in foreign countries due to appreciation of foreign currencies in their relation to the American dollar, is hereby amended to read as follows:
"(e) while attached to and serving on board United States vessels stationed in foreign waters for not less than 60 consecutive days."
This order shall be effective this date.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 6880-Amendment of Executive Order No. 6657-A, Dated March 27, 1934 Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/362587
